item.title: Very uneven pavement., 14th February
item.description:
Crossing the road with dogs, and tripped over on the uneven pavement. I tripped over and feel into the road on my knees and damaged my knees. This needs to be sorted asap.

item.title: Dustbins left on the pavement, 14th February
item.description:
Bins are left on the pavement all the time on my road accumulating rubbish from pedestrians also some are left on the pavement as their property cannot accommodate dustbins in their front gardens .
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Barretts Grove, Hackney, London

item.title: Road needs daily cleaning, 14th February
item.description:
2 schools and 2 churches at either end of road plus weekend car boot sale when they leave unsold items on the road. Friday Saturdays pub goers sick covers our road plus dog poo that’s left by dog lovers. Road is used by many pedestrian
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Barretts Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road work., 14th February
item.description:
Pomeroy street is known for having difficult two way congestion and the additional road works has made the area very difficult to drive through, especially for residents that use the street on w regular basis. Can the council make sure that residents are notified of these major inconveniences and to apply common sense such as 3 day traffic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Pomeroy Street, New Cross Gate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Collapsed paving slab close to the road. Gives way when walked on., 14th February
item.description:
Collapsed slab on the pavement, close to the street. It appears sound but gives way when walked on. High risk of falling over as it collapses by about 10 inches.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Balls Pond Road, Dalston, Greater London

item.title: Broken glass on the pavement, 14th February
item.description:
There is at least a 3m stretch of the pavement which is covered in glass shards from something that looks like a massive glass jar (like 20L large). Not sure if the pavement has a cleaning service, but in the past it seemed like the glass was just scooped to the side instead of picking it up
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Tetherdown, Muswell Hill, Greater London

item.title: Pathway obstruction, 14th February
item.description:
The pathway is completely blocked from overhanging vegetation. This is right on a bend at the roundabout opposite summerton way. You have to walk in the road just to pass, but as it’s a bend you can’t see if traffic is oncoming. This is an accident waiting to happen

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crossway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
